p: Belonging in Onychiuroidae, the families Onychiuridae and Tullbergiidae are characterized by the presence of special cuticular structures called pseudocelli, which secrete repellant substances [ 9]. The Neanuridae family subdivided into six subfamilies: Caputanurininae, Morulininae, Uchidanurinae, Frieseinae, Neanurinae sensu Cassagnau [ 10] and Pseudachorutinae, these last two are the most diversified [ 8, 11]. The Neotropical Poduromorpha fauna can be largely characterized by Pseudachorutinae, which presents many endemic taxa, including the genus Brasilimeria Stach, 1949 [ 12]; defined by Stach [ 13] and characterized by the absence of PAO and furca, the presence of 6+6 eyes disposed in a semi-circle, and large sized adult specimens. Today it includes only two species, Brasilimeria anura (Arlé, 1939) and Brasilimeria wygodzinskyi (Arlé, 1943), which have been described in Southeastern Brazil. The species herein described; Brasilimeria assu sp. nov., was found in the same Brazilian region, a well-known biodiversity hotspot of the Brazilian Atlantic Tropical Forest.
